org.neuroph.contrib.neat.gen.operations
Interface Speciator

All Known Implementing Classes:
DynamicThresholdSpeciator, SimpleSpeciator, SimpleSpeciator
public interface Speciator

A Speciator is responsible for examining the Organisms for a generation and determining the Specie that the Organism should belong to.

Author:
Aidan Morgan

Method Summary
 double compare(Organism one, Organism two)
          Used to return a comparison score between two Organism instances.
 void speciate(NeatParameters params, java.util.List<Specie> species, FitnessScores scores, java.util.List<Organism> chromosomes)

Method Detail

speciate

void speciate(NeatParameters params,
              java.util.List<Specie> species,
              FitnessScores scores,
              java.util.List<Organism> chromosomes)
Performs the speciation for the provided Organisms. If a Organism should belong to an existing species add it to the correct Specie, if no existing Specie exists then create a new one and add it to the List of Species provided. After this operation has completed, ALL Organisms should be associated with a Specie.

Parameters:
params - the NeatParameters that define the environment in which this operation is performed.
species - a List of existing Species for the evolution. If an Organism does not belong to an existing Specie then a new one should be created and added to this List.
scores -
chromosomes - a List of Organisms to evaluate for which Specie they should belong to.

compare

double compare(Organism one,
               Organism two)
Used to return a comparison score between two Organism instances.

Parameters:
one - the first Organism to compare.
two - the second Organism to compare.
Returns:
the comparison score for the two provided Organisms.
